title.native: とある科学の一方通行【アクセラレータ】

description:
The espers of Academy City are classified into six levels, where "Level 0" lacks power while "Level 5" possesses an overwhelming amount. Of the several million espers residing in Academy City, only seven of them have attained Level 5, and ranked highest among them is the one known as Accelerator.

Toaru Kagaku no Accelerator focuses on the strongest Level 5 after he protects the cheerful Last Order at the price of much of his power. Recovering at the hospital, Accelerator has led a relatively quiet life until he ends up saving the life of Estelle Rosenthal, a mysterious girl carrying a photo of Last Order. Unfortunately, Accelerator now finds himself dragged into a new conflict in the form of a sinister organization called Disciplinary Action which plots to use Last Order for a dangerous mission. Now that they have set their plan into motion and are in pursuit of the young girl, it's up to the world's most powerful esper and his newfound companion to protect Last Order and defend Academy City in the process.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: แอคเซลเลอร์เรเตอร์ แฟ้มลับคดีวิทยาศาสตร์
แฟ้มลับคดีเด็กหาย
Máy gia tốc khoa học nhất định

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

node.description:
[Official website](http://dengekibunko.jp/author/kamachikazuma/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kamachi_ka)

Kazuma Kamachi is a Japanese light novel author and the original creator of the Toaru Majutsu no Index light novel series and its spin-off manga series, Toaru Kagaku no Railgun and Toaru Kagaku no Accelerator.

As he uses a pen name, his real name and identity is as of yet unknown.

Before becoming the famous writer of the Index light novel series, Kamachi wrote a story entitled Schrödinger's City (シュレディンガーの街 Shuredingā no Machi?) as an entry in the  9th Dengeki Game Novel Prize; unfortunately, his submission failed to reach past the third selection stage of the said competition. However, his story caught the attention of the editor-in-chief of Dengeki, and Kamachi later became in-charge in writing the book Kaite-minai ka? (書いてみないか？? lit., Want to Try Writing?), which became his debut as a professional writer.

Kamachi began writing novels while he was still studying as a junior high school student. However, his works were not finished until he graduated from high school.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Website](https://thesixthlie.jp)

The Sixth Lie is a Japanese electronic rock band formed in May 2015 in Tokyo, Japan. Their music is known for its hybrid style inspired by the latest western music, and their overall science fiction-inspired theme connected to near future and outer space.

__[Website](https://whv-amusic.com/sajounohana/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sajounohana)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sajounohana/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/JPN_sajou-no-hana-192527894722117/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCleWyL3f1xJU3Huj7NzRE5Q)__

__Formed:__ 2018
__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative), Shoegazer, Anison

__Biography:__
sajou no hana is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label Warner Brothers Home Entertainment (2018-). Their singer initially debuted in 2016 as the vocalist of the seiyuu collaboration [MOB CHOIR](https://anilist.co/staff/161167/Mob-Choir) under the name 37, who performed the opening theme to the first season of [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/Mob-Psycho-100/).

__Members:__
- [sana](https://anilist.co/staff/296329) (さな) - vocalist
- [Sho Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/109345) (渡辺翔) - keyboardist, in-charge of lyrics, composition, arrangement and programming
- [Tatsuya Kitani](https://anilist.co/staff/161639/Tatsuya-Kitani) (キタニタツヤ) - guitarist and bassist, in-charge of lyrics, composition, arrangement and programming

(Source: [Wikipedia (sajou no hana)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sajou_no_hana), edited)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松倉友二)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/) since 1992, where he currently serves as the Executive Officer and General Manager of Production Headquarters. Also the representative director of Jam Creation.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/111209/)._

The founder and representative director of [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

In 1976, Miyata joined [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/), and was assigned to the planning and literature department. Three years later he moved to being a producer.  After having left Tatsunoko he joined [Kitty Film](https://anilist.co/studio/99/) for some time before founding J.C. Staff in 1986.

After producing numerous works for J.C. Staff in the late '80s and throughout the '90s - he shifted his focus to a more managerial position in 2000, a position which he still holds to this day while serving as the studio's representative director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nishiki_hiroshi)

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nishiki_hiroshi)

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.
A producer and co-founder of [A.C.G.T](https://anilist.co/studio/179/ACGT) together with [Shoujirou Abe](https://anilist.co/staff/192367/).
